clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: A bronchodilator used for the long term symptomatic treatment of reversible bronchoconstriction in patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease COPD including chronic bronchitis and emphysema

contraindications.disease: A death was reported in dogs after a single oral dose of 5 mg kg approximately 4500 times the maximum recommended daily inhalation dose in adults on a mg m2 basis As with all inhaled sympathomimetic medications cardiac arrest and even death may be associated with an overdose
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Arformoterol the active R R enantiomer of formoterol is a selective long acting β2 adrenergic receptor agonist beta2 agonist that has two fold greater potency than racemic formoterol which contains both the S S and R R enantiomers The S S enantiomer is about 1 000 fold less potent as a β2 agonist than the R R enantiomer Arformoterol seems to have little or no effect on β1 adrenergic receptors

incompatibilities.description: The therapeutic efficacy of Arformoterol can be decreased when used in combination with Loxapine
